SENT.plain: A case of heparin resistance and its management during cardiopulmonary bypass is reported
A patient with a history of post-infarct angina and arrhythmias was treated with intravenous heparin infusion for five days prior to myocardial revascularisation surgery
He required 13,500 IU/kg of heparin to increase his activated clotting time to a therapeutic level for safe institution of cardiopulmonary bypass
This phenomenon of heparin resistance was postulated to be due to consumption of circulating antithrombin III as a result of prior heparinisation
Treatment with fresh frozen plasma restored heparin effectiveness
